H0.text: Deer were most likely affected by the drop in population of fish, otters, and seals following the 1989 oil spill off the coast of Alaska.

H1.text: Eagles were the population most likely affected by the decline in fish, otters, and seals following the 1989 oil spill off the coast of Alaska.

H2.text: Frogs were the other population most likely affected by the decline in fish, otters, and seals after the 1989 oil spill off the coast of Alaska.

H3.text: Snakes were the population most likely affected by the drop in fish, otters, and seals resulting from the 1989 oil spill off the coast of Alaska.

A5.text: the spill damaged stocks of salmon and herring in the area.
